greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least natural number k such that k^2 + n is prime.
comment: First values of k and n such that k > 100 are: k=114, n=6041; for k > 200: k=210, n=26171; for k > 300: k=357, n=218084; for k > 400: k=402, n=576239.
It is easily proved that for n > 2, a(n) >= A089128(n+1). The first inequality is a(21) = 4. - _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, May 16 2018
link: Zak Seidov, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
maple: a:= proc(n) local d, t; d, t:= 1, n+1; while not
isprime(t) do d:= d+2; t:= t+d od; (d+1)/2
mathematica: Table[i = 1; While[! PrimeQ[i^2 + n], i++]; i, {n, 85}] (* _Jayanta Basu_, Apr 24 2013 *)
program: (PARI) a(n)=my(k); while(!isprime(k++^2+n),); k \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Jul 17 2016
results.author: _Jason Earls_, Aug 10 2003
